alert.note: Alert for Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 21 at 6:52PM CDT until June 21 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Texas County in the Panhandle of Oklahoma... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 652 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 5 miles south of Eva, or 19 miles south of Elkhart, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Texas County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Amarillo.
